Yaeji Jang

3958 Oleander Ct, CA 91302 · (201) 913-4339 · yaeji.jang@pepperdine.edu

I’m a fourth-year Physics student at Pepperdine University with a deep passion for expanding access to dental care in underserved communities. By combining my academic background with a commitment to service, I aspire to help build a future where everyone—regardless of their background—can receive the care they deserve.

Experience

Project Leader

Auroral Activity- Solar Wind Interaction Research

Analyzed 10 years of auroral data to investigate solar wind-magnetosphere interactions using ground-based optical observations and NASA spacecraft data. Tracked auroral oval shifts and identified Poleward-Moving Auroral Forms (PMAFs) as ionospheric signatures of magnetic reconnection. Utilized python-based algorithm and conducted statistical analysis to establish connection between solar wind parameters (IMF orientation, speed, pressure) and their influence on auroral activity. Presented findings at the Southern California Conference for Undergraduate Research(SCCUR) and American Geophysical Union 2023 & 2024.

August 2022- Present

Dental Assistant

Santa Monica Esthetic Dentistry

While pursuing my Physics degree, I’ve completed over 400 hours as a part-time Dental Assistant and am on track to becoming Head Dental Assistant. I assist with chairside procedures, maintain strict infection control standards, and support hygienists with periocharting and procedural setups. I also take dental impressions, pour stone models, and craft custom whitening trays and nightguards. Administratively, I manage scheduling and patient records using Dentrix and improved inventory flow by introducing a task delegation system. I prioritize patient comfort by easing anxiety with reassurance and comfort items. Beyond the clinic, I launched a volunteer shadowing program and have gained over 500 hours of shadowing experience myself, deepening my understanding of clinical techniques and patient-centered care.

December 2011 - March 2013

Math Tutor

Student Success Center, Pepperdine University

As a Math Tutor, I provide individualized support in subjects ranging from Algebra to Calculus III, adapting explanations to fit each student’s learning style. I also assist students in physics, bridging their understanding between math and science. My approach focuses on building confidence and persistence by using personalized strategies such as acronyms, visual aids, and guided problem-solving. I regularly help students close foundational gaps and improve performance, and I develop tailored study guides to support their learning outside of sessions.

July 2010 - December 2011

Physics Teaching Assistant

Natural Science Division, Pepperdine University

During my time as a Physics Teaching Assistant, I supported over 40 students by offering feedback on lab reports and providing academic guidance.I managed grading using Excel and the university’s Courses system, ensuring accurate and timely recordkeeping. I also collaborated with the professor to improve assessment methods, all while balancing 9 hours per week of TA responsibilities with a full academic course load.

Business Calculus Grader

Natural Science Division, Pepperdine University

As a Business Calculus Grader, I evaluated over 900 assignments with precision and provided detailed feedback to enhance student understanding. I supported over 90 students through coursework assistance and worked closely with professors to ensure clarity and consistency in grading. I was also responsible for managing and uploading grades through the Courses system, helping maintain efficient and accurate course administration.

Student Library Assistant

Pepperdine Drescher Graduate Library & Harnish Law Library

As a Student Assistant, I support daily library operations by assisting students, faculty, and visitors with general inquiries, book reservations, and navigation of campus resources. I manage book check-ins and check-outs using OCLC, help locate materials, and process online reservations efficiently. I curate monthly themed book displays to highlight diverse voices and current events, and I contribute to a welcoming atmosphere by maintaining a clean environment and fully stocked coffee station. I also support Bloomberg terminal users, stay informed to assist business students, and help organize and promote library events and programs. My responsibilities include tracking patron visits for data reporting and ensuring the shelves remain orderly and accessible for all users.

Interests

Apart from being a web developer, I enjoy most of my time being outdoors. In the winter, I am an avid skier and novice ice climber. During the warmer months here in Colorado, I enjoy mountain biking, free climbing, and kayaking.

When forced indoors, I follow a number of sci-fi and fantasy genre movies and television shows, I am an aspiring chef, and I spend a large amount of my free time exploring the latest technology advancements in the front-end web development world.
